item.title: Rockferry
item.description: Debut album from the young Welsh soul siren.

item.title: Elephunk
item.description: LA hip hop crew's third album, full throttle funk.

item.title: Goodbye Yellow Brick Road
item.description: Original double album now single CD release, reckoned by some to be Sir Elton's finest, from rockers like Satuday Night's Alright for Fighting to the classis ballad Candle in the Wind.

item.title: Below the Salt
item.description: Maddy Prior leads on this carefully chosen selection of traditional folk songs.

item.title: Abraxas
item.description: Commercial breakthrough album for Santana showcasing their post-Woodstock talent at its best.

item.title: Twelve Dreams of Dr Sardonicus
item.description: Spitit\'s final and finest experimental album.

item.title: Achtung Baby
item.description: More techno-rock than stadium pop, this album marked a change of direction for U2.

item.title: Fisherman's Blues
item.description: Going back to their Celtic roots for these folk rockers, backed by fiddles and acoustic guitars.

item.title: The Delivery Man
item.description: Backed again by the Imposters, this is a concept album featuring a selection of fine guest appearances from the likes of Lucimda Williams.

item.title: Dead Man's Suit
item.description: Tuneful soft rock debut with some standout lyrics.

item.title: The Owl of Minerva
item.description: Ground breaking collection from Brighton based team, previously only available on Vinyl.

item.title: Surfer Rosa
item.description: Typically abrasive selection of guitar and vocal combinationsClassic.

item.title: Neon Bible
item.description: Second release from the Canadian folk rockers, easily passing the predecessor in scope and depth.

item.title: Separation Sunday
item.description: Play it loud - original take on classic rock. Recommended.

item.title: Blue
item.description: Introspective and highly personal, Joni Mitchell bares her soul on this all time classic.

item.title: Solid Air
item.description: Landmark album crossing from the folky to free form, jazz improvisation. Conatining the all time great May You Never.

item.title: Couldn't Stand The Weather
item.description: The second album from the late and almented Vaughan, consolidating his position as a leading light of modern blues.

item.title: Enjoy The Melodic Sunshine
item.description: Hard to believe this Glasgow group can produce the sunniest West Coast rock and best harmonies since The Byrds

item.title: Live At Folsom Prison
item.description: Quintessential Cash, recorded live at Folsom Prison. With his wife June Carter Cash.

item.title: Live at the Apollo
item.description: One of the greatest live albums of all time, from a performer at the peak of his career.

item.title: Hold Your Colour
item.description: Classic debut album

item.title: The Fat Of The Land
item.description: Third studio album, featuring the singles Firestarterand Breathe
